### ğŸ“‹ Next Steps:

If you want to initialize a new Git repository later:

```bash
git init
git add .
git commit -m "Initial commit with dual storage integration"
```

Or if you want to connect to a remote repository:

```bash
git init
git remote add origin <your-repo-url>
git add .
git commit -m "Initial commit with dual storage integration"
git push -u origin main
```
